alert.note: Alert for Echols; Southern Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 11:57PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Baker, northern Columbia, northern Suwannee, Hamilton, Echols, south central Ware and Clinch Counties through 1245 AM EST... At 1157 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Suwannee River State Park, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Jasper, Homerville, Jennings, White Springs, Fargo, Statenville, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Springs and Du Pont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
